title: Hotel & Hospitality Terms
description: Check in to the world of hotel and hospitality vocabulary used across the travel industry

questions.question: In hotel terminology, what does 'concierge' refer to?
options: A hotel staff member who assists guests with information, reservations, and special requests

questions.question: What does 'all-inclusive' mean in the hotel industry?
options: A package where meals, drinks, activities, and often entertainment are included in the room price
The hotel has all room types

questions.question: In hotel language, what is a 'suite'?
options: A set of connected rooms, typically including a separate sitting area or living space
A candy left on the pillow
A sweet deal on a room

questions.question: What does 'turndown service' mean in a hotel?
options: An evening service where staff prepare the room for sleeping by folding back the bedding
Turning down the lights at night

questions.question: In hospitality, what is 'RevPAR'?
options: Revenue Per Available Room — a key metric measuring hotel financial performance

questions.question: What does 'comp' mean in hotel and hospitality?
options: Complimentary — given free of charge as a courtesy or promotion

questions.question: In hotel terminology, what is 'check-in time'?
options: The earliest time a guest can occupy their room, typically in the afternoon

questions.question: What is a 'bellhop' (or 'bellboy') in a hotel?
options: A staff member who carries guests' luggage and escorts them to their rooms

questions.question: In hospitality, what does 'amenities' refer to?
options: Features, services, and extras provided for guest comfort, such as toiletries, Wi-Fi, and pools

questions.question: What is a 'boutique hotel'?
options: A hotel with a gift shop
A small, stylish hotel with a distinctive character, unique design, and personalized service

questions.question: In hotel terminology, what does 'rack rate' mean?
options: The standard published room rate before any discounts are applied

questions.question: What is 'valet parking' at a hotel?
options: A service where staff park and retrieve guests' vehicles for them

questions.question: In the hotel industry, what does 'occupancy rate' measure?
options: The number of guests per room
The percentage of available rooms that are occupied at a given time
How many staff are on duty

questions.question: What does 'half board' mean in hotel accommodation?
options: A rate that includes breakfast and one other meal, usually dinner
A room with a partial view

questions.question: In hospitality, what is a 'loyalty program'?
options: A rewards system where returning guests earn points or perks for repeat stays
